Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "The vow of celibacy should be abandoned", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the context of this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: A vow of celibacy is an archaic stricture that limits the freedoms of priests and harms their relationship with the world as they are less relatable to normal people and are suppressing their natural drives.<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy is too pressuring/diffcult
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that a vow of celibacy is an archaic stricture that limits the freedoms of priests and harms their relationship with the world as they are less relatable to normal people and are suppressing their natural drives.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: The vow of celibacy should be a personal choice, no one should be denied this right, it can allow religious leaders to feel closer to their god and remove distractions from their faith<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy allows a priest to focus on god
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that the vow of celibacy should be a personal choice, no one should be denied this right, it can allow religious leaders to feel closer to their god and remove distractions from their faith

Positive Examples.input: Argument: The requirement of celibacy by religious leaders deters individuals from religious vocations<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy is outdated
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that the requirement of celibacy by religious leaders deters individuals from religious vocations

Negative Examples.input: Argument: The vow of celibacy is antiquated and obsolete in today's world, therefore it should be abandoned.<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy is too pressuring/diffcult
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that the vow of celibacy is antiquated and obsolete in today's world, therefore it should be abandoned.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: We should not abandon the vow of celibacy because it is a centuries old custom that is seen as sacred and holy.<sep>Keypoint: Religious experiences and traditions should be maintained
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that we should not abandon the vow of celibacy because it is a centuries old custom that is seen as sacred and holy.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: The vow of celibacy is an important part of the religious experience of some and should not be taken away.<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy allows a priest to focus on god
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that the vow of celibacy is an important part of the religious experience of some and should not be taken away.

Argument: Celibacy is the only 100% effective way to prevent pregnancy<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy allows a priest to focus on god
Argument: The vow of celibacy is an outdated thinking<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy is too pressuring/diffcult

Argument: Celibacy is a state of purity the church should maintain as a devotion to god. it demonstrates a priests sacrifice and commitment to religious principals and allows people to place faith in their leaders .<sep>Keypoint: Priests choose to be celibates
Argument: Celibacy allows the priest to be completely focused on his parish community without distraction.<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy makes the priests to be perceived as holy
Argument: Vow of celibacy is important for some religious members and should be allowed to remain.<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy allows a priest to focus on god

Argument: The vow of celibacy should be abandoned because it is unhealthy for anyone to repress feelings of desire and often leads to ghastly scandals in churches taking advantage of little children.<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy is too pressuring/diffcult
Argument: It should be abandoned because they have the same desires as every human has<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy is outdated
Argument: It is a vow that has been a long held tradition in the church and shouldn't be changed<sep>Keypoint: Religious experiences and traditions should be maintained

Argument: The urge of physical needs may interfere with the ability to be a good religious person, celibacy allow clergymen to focus on higher things<sep>Keypoint: Celibacy is a strong religious belief
